sections.heading: The board of county commissioners or the county board of
sections.text:
any county may appropriate a sum of money not to exceed $600 a year, for
the support and education of a student
in any military
school operating in the State, which has been declared by the Governor to
be a post of the Illinois National Guard under and by virtue of the
provisions of "An Act to provide for the annual inspection of the several
departments of the universities, colleges, academies and other educational
institutions organized under the laws of the State of Illinois," filed June
26, 1895, and amendments thereto.

sections.heading: The Superintendent of an Educational Service Region, in
sections.text:
counties where such an appropriation has been made, shall conduct a
competitive examination to select the student who is to be awarded the
scholarship, and one alternate.

sections.heading: Short title.
sections.text:
This Act may be cited as the
Military School Scholarship Act.
